channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Meta is spending millions on bug bounties and security tools to boost WhatsApp security
item.description: New tools, expanded reach and a boosted bug bounty program are coming for WhatsApp.

item.title: L’Europe veut mettre fin au calvaire des bannières à cookies
item.description: Les fenêtres de demande de consentement pour les cookies partaient d'une bonne intention, mais leur prolifération sur internet les a rendues complètement indigestes pour les internautes comme pour les sites. Bruxelles veut remettre de l’ordre dans ce maquis numérique en simplifiant les règles et en redonnant du sens au consentement.

item.title: Google Maps is adding 4 new features to help you navigate the holiday season
item.description: Google Maps has some presents for you this holiday season, to help you discover new places and avoid the crowds.

item.title: Why January Ventures is funding underrepresented AI founders
item.description: While everyone’s chasing the next AI infrastructure play in San Francisco, some of the most defensible AI companies are being built by founders with deep expertise in legacy industries — and they’re not getting funded. January Ventures aims to fill that gap, writing pre-seed checks for underrepresented founders transforming healthcare, manufacturing, and supply chain with […]...

item.title: Affordable Care Act ‘subsidy cliff’: Here’s who’s in danger of falling off with premium tax credits set to expire by 2026
item.description: Congress is currently debating the fate of the Obamacare subsidies as millions of Americans wait in health insurance limbo. Millions of Americans who buy health insurance through the Affordable Care Act (ACA), also known as “Obamacare,” stand to lose their premium subsidies, with less than three weeks to go until they expire at the end of 2025. And the result of that would be skyrocketing health care costs for 22 million marketplace users....

item.title: This Nespresso Vertuo Pop bundle has dropped to a record-low price for Black Friday
item.description: Get the Nespresso Vertuo Pop coffee maker and a handy milk frother for a low price with this limited-time bundle deal

item.title: Ford recalls more than 200,000 Bronco and Bronco Sports over instrument panel
item.description: Federal auto safety regulators said that the instrument panel may not display at startup, leaving the driver without critical safety information. Ford Motor Co. is recalling more than 200,000 Bronco and Bronco Sport vehicles because an instrument panel can fail, increasing the risk of a crash.

item.title: ‘Toy Story 5’ Wants to Be About More Than Just Tech Anxiety
item.description: Despite what it looked like, 'Toy Story 5' has more on its mind than kids being on them dang tablets and phones all day.

item.title: Subletting startup Kiki paid over $152K to settle charges after violating NYC short-term rental laws
item.description: Kiki Club, a subletting startup that matches listers and renters, violated NYC laws and had to pay the city over $152,000 to settle charges.

item.title: Want better answers from ChatGPT or Gemini? Here’s how to tweak your prompts the right way
item.description: The key to getting better results in AI chatbots is to perfect the way you write your prompts.

item.title: The Google Search of AI agents? Fetch launches ASI:One and Business tier for new era of non-human web
item.description: Fetch AI, a startup founded and led by former DeepMind founding investor, Humayun Sheikh, today announced the release of three interconnected products designed to provide the trust, coordination, and interoperability needed for large-scale AI agent ecosystems. The launch includes ASI:One, a personal-AI orchestration platform; Fetch Business, a verification and discovery portal for brand agents; and Agentverse, an open directory hosting more than two million agents. Together, the system positions Fetch as an infrastructure provider for what it calls the “Agentic Web”—a layer where consumer AIs ...

item.title: This Amazon Fire TV is one of the best budget models I've tested, and it's just hit a record-low price for Black Friday
item.description: The Amazon Omni QLED is a great budget TV, and its price has been slashed ahead of Black Friday.

item.title: Bluesky announces moderation changes focused on better tracking, improved transparency
item.description: Bluesky is making moderation changes, including the addition of new reporting categories, strikes, and more clarity when communicating with users about violations.

item.title: Wi-Fi : l’iPhone 17 progresse fort avec la puce N1 mais un smartphone Android reste devant
item.description: On l'attendait au tournant, cette fameuse puce maison. Après des années de rumeurs et de retards, Apple a enfin coupé le cordon avec Broadcom pour équiper ses iPhone 17 et Air. Résultat ? Vous allez voir.

item.title: Finally, Vision Pro-Level VR Headsets May Get Cheaper
item.description: Cheaper parts could revive what are otherwise overpriced headsets that few people can afford.

item.title: Ransomware attack hits LG battery subsidiary
item.description: Akira claims LG Energy Solution breach, and says it stole 1.7TB of sensitive data.

item.title: Paramount+ débarque sur les Freebox : 1 mois offert, mais attention à l’offre proposée
item.description: C’est officiel, le service de streaming Paramount+ est désormais intégré nativement dans l'écosystème Freebox. Accessible depuis hier, cette nouveauté s'accompagne d'un mois d'essai gratuit pour les abonnés.

item.title: Amazon brade les écrans PC pour le Black Friday, comme avec ce Samsung Odyssey G8 Oled de 32″ OLED et 240 Hz
item.description: Les écrans gaming ont tourné la page de la simple dalle LCD. Aujourd’hui, ils se pavanent en OLED, les dernières générations arbore fièrement l'OLED, s’illuminent de HDR et explosent les compteurs avec des taux de rafraîchissement élevés. C'est le cas du Samsung Odyssey G8-G81SF qui fait fondre son prix sur Amazon pour le presque Black Friday : de 1 299 euros à 949 euros. ...

item.title: Amazon’s Prime Video is getting AI-generated Video Recaps for some TV shows
item.description: According to Amazon, the feature "utilizes generative AI to create theatrical-quality season recaps with synchronized narration, dialogue, and music."

item.title: Amazon is trialing using AI to generate recaps for some of your favorite Prime Video TV shows
item.description: Prime Video is testing using AI to generate quick video recaps of TV shows, courtesy of a new US beta dubbed 'Video Recap'.

item.title: Conférence sur l’IA | Un robot russe présente ses talents à Vladimir Poutine
item.description: Un des premiers robots russes dotés d’une intelligence artificielle (IA) intégrée, développé par la Sberbank, a dansé pour accueillir le président russe Vladimir Poutine lors de la 10e conférence internationale AI Journey 2025 à Moscou, en Russie, mercredi.

item.title: US, UK, and Australia sanction Russian ‘bulletproof’ web host used in ransomware attacks
item.description: The newly imposed sanctions target Russian-based web host Media Land, which officials say are linked to LockBit and BlackSuit ransomware attacks.

item.title: Grok dans Siri ? La proposition d’Elon Musk alors que l’iPhone s’ouvre à la concurrence
item.description: Il faut suivre, avec Elon Musk. En août, il traînait Apple en justice pour avoir intégré ChatGPT. Aujourd'hui ? Il propose gentiment d'intégrer sa propre IA, Grok 4.1, directement dans Siri.

item.title: L’Australie teste l’interdiction totale des réseaux sociaux aux moins de 16 ans
item.description: L'Australie a pris le taureau par les cornes : à compter du 10 décembre, les mineurs de moins de 16 ans ne pourront tout simplement plus utiliser les réseaux sociaux comme TikTok, Facebook ou Instagram. Meta, visé au premier chef, prévient que la mesure ne sera pas facile à mettre en œuvre. Pendant ce temps, d'autres pays regardent avec attention ce qui ressemble à un laboratoire....

item.title: Asus routers across the globe hit by suspected Chinese cyberattack - here's what we know
item.description: State-sponsored actors are creating a large operational relay network and are using Taiwanese routers to do so.

item.title: Amazon Is Bringing ‘Stargate’ Back to TV
item.description: 'Stargate' veteran Martin Gero will create the new show, which is based on the hit 1994 film and multiple TV spinoffs.

item.title: This Home Robot Clears Tables and Loads the Dishwasher All by Itself
item.description: Sunday Robotics has a new way to train robots to do common household tasks. The startup plans to put its fully autonomous robots in homes next year.

item.title: YC-backed Poly relaunches as a cloud-hosted file storage with AI search
item.description: Poly's cloud based file storage system with AI-powered search lets you search through text, images, audio, and video.

item.title: The WNBA labor fight is the latest in a long history of women-led worker movements
item.description: How more than a century of women-led labor activism is influencing the league’s current collective bargaining negotiations. When Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier calmly sat down and told a group of assembled local media the WNBA is helmed by “the worst leadership in the world” on September 30, she likely did so with a full understanding of the potential impact of her words. ...

item.title: Adobe to buy digital marketing platform Semrush for $1.9 billion
item.description: Semrush designs and develops AI software that helps companies with search engine optimization, social media, and digital advertising. Adobe will acquire software platform Semrush for $1.9 billion, the companies said on Wednesday, as the Photoshop maker looks to strengthen its marketing tools and attract brands with generative artificial intelligence products....
